extendedInfo.description: Great for Getting Things Done! (GTD, tasks, to do)Creates a pre-populated email using the email address, subject, and message of your choosing. Can be used in other apps via the Share menu or as a Home Screen shortcut.With Email Me, not only can you email web pages, but you can also email just about anything from Android's Share menu. This includes files, photos, tweets, you name it!Check out Email Me Pro if you want to send emails automatically (bypassing the email compose screen). Email Me Pro also allows you to create multiple email templates (e.g., a template for notes, to do items, work), schedule emails to be sent at regular intervals (such as daily or weekly), and it integrates with Tasker!Keywords: Email, Me, Mail, Note, Share, Self, Myself, Yourself, Link, GTD, Task, Tasker, Locale, Plugin, SMTP, Schedule, Automatic, Template, Attachment

reviews.title: Only free 1 click option I found
reviews.comment: I tried Compose Mail Shortcut, Quick Email Compose, and another one, and none of them had a 1 click button from the home screen that filled in the \"to\" address automatically.  This was perfect.
reviews.author: Jason Gladish

reviews.title: Decided to use SelfMail instead
reviews.comment: This program is great but the free version doesn\'t allow direct-sending without opening the email app. SelfMail allows this for free!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Should have more widget options
reviews.comment: Widget options are limited.  Should have an option for no text.
reviews.author: wesley doremus

reviews.title: Excellent app - what happened in the update
reviews.comment: Love this app - very simple.  ... but what happened to it in the recent update? The cursor now defaults to the \'To\' line rather than the body of the email. Very frustrating to have to select the body before you start writing the email to yourself.
reviews.author: Graham Cottrell

reviews.comment: Can\'t get past the settings...so it\'s useless.  If anyone can tell me what the step is after selecting all the options in the settings,  PLEASE DO!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: The only app which does it all!
reviews.comment: Huge timesaver and the app is done right!  The only (minor) negative is since this is done as widget I could not drag it into quick access line of four apps in the bottom of my screen. The rest is just fine!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Absolutely necessary app that\'s small & simple. Others have complained about having to recheck their default email app after an update; which does happened every once in a while. However, it\'s really not a big deal for me to have to press on the gmail option in the dialogue box. Definitely not enough to knock down a star.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Essential, Effective and simple
reviews.comment: Does what it says it does. A must have office tool. Very pleased here.
reviews.author: Tock Teebles

reviews.title: Works perfectly.
reviews.comment: I use it to email myself reminders. 3 simple steps. Hit the shortcut. Type message. Send message. You can compose default subject or body in settings. This eliminates gmail asking if you want it left blank since I generally only type in subject. Very simple. Exactly what I wanted. Experia Mini Pro.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app for sending ToDos
reviews.comment: is a great app for putting a shortcut on your homepage that will allow you to send an email quickly to yourself or somebody else
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: GTD necessity
reviews.comment: This is exactly what I was looking for. It\'s perfect for collecting things throughout the day in a place I know I\'ll look at later for processing.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Simple
reviews.comment: Exactly what I what I wanted.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Sucks
reviews.comment: Are All the positive ads from developers?  This app sends nothing.
reviews.author: A Google User
